description.plain: Demetria Devonne “Demi” Lovato (born August 20, 1992) is an American singer-songwriter, musician, and actress. She made her debut as a child actress in Barney & Friends. In 2008, she came to prominence as a starring cast member in the television film Camp Rock. She signed to Hollywood Records the same year, and released her debut studio album Don’t Forget in September 2008. It has been certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In 2009, Lovato was commissioned her television series, Sonny with a Chance. Now in 2018, she had six studio albums, “Don’t Forget” in 2008, “Here we go again” in 2009, “Unbroken” in 2011, “Confident” in 2015 and “Tell Me You Love Me” in 2017.

songs.full_title: Sorry Not Sorry by Demi Lovato

annotatable.link_title: Sorry Not Sorry by Demi Lovato
annotatable.title: Sorry Not Sorry

body.plain:
“Sorry Not Sorry” is an anthem towards Demi’s haters. In it, Demi confidently shows herself off to her haters, which makes them feel annoyed that she’s looking and feeling so good and they’re not. The track is lead single from her sixth album, Tell Me You Love Me.

The single was teased by Lovato and her team through cryptic updates on her social media accounts with the hashtag #SNS.

The song peaked at #6 on the Billboard Hot 100, which made it Demi Lovato’s highest career peak, besting her #9 peak of 2009’s “This Is Me.”

songs.full_title: Sober by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
“Sober” is a single from Demi Lovato. A lyric video was uploaded to her official Youtube channel.

The song provides an open confession about facing recent challenges regarding her six-year sobriety. She made her achievement public on Twitter in March 2018:

https://mobile.twitter.com/ddlovato/status/974142838735884294?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw&ref_url=http%3A%2F%2Fpopcrush.com%2Fdemi-lovato-celebrates-6-years-sober%2F

However, the lyrics indicate how she may have possibly relapsed; her prior battle with addiction included the use of prescription drugs, cocaine, and alcohol.

Her 2017 documentary, Simply Complicated, depicts her mixed struggle with addiction, bipolar disorder, and childhood experiences which have shaped her life and influenced her journey through fame and fortune.

https://giphy.com/gifs/demilovato-l4Ep3I9jWu72K1wty

annotatable.title: Tell Me You Love Me

body.plain:
“Tell Me You Love Me' is the title track of Demi Lovato’s sixth studio album Tell Me You Love Me. In the song, Demi Lovato shows her vulnerability and emphasizes the need for a relationship in her life. It then progresses to realizing that at the end of the day all you need, and what you will always have, is yourself.

The song was released as the first promotional single from Lovato'’s sixth studio album Tell Me You Love Me on August 23, 2017. It was then later released as the second single from the album on November 14, 2017.

songs.full_title: Stone Cold by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
“Stone Cold” is the third single of the album Confident, released on 9 October 2015. Unlike the previous two singles, it’s a tender ballad about wishing an ex the best in another relationship.

Demi Lovato played the song for the first time live during her performance at the Highline Ballroom in New York on 29 September 2015.

Demi Lovato told Complex in a 2015 interview that “Stone Cold” is her favorite song off of the album. “I want the Grammy committee to hear [that song],” she said, “so that one day they can see that—I know that I’m capable of getting there.”

songs.full_title: Anyone by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
For her first solo release in 18 months, American singer-songwriter Demi Lovato dropped the emotional track, “Anyone,” as her comeback single shortly before her debut performance of the song at the 62nd GRAMMY Awards. In the vulnerable ballad, Demi can be heard crying for help as she talks about wanting someone to be there through the tough times with her.

Speaking to Zane Lowe in an interview on Apple Music’s New Music Daily, Demi recalled that no one had helped her with her struggles back when she wrote and recorded the song days before her drug overdose back in July of 2018:


I almost listen back and hear these lyrics as a cry for help. [And] you kind of think, “How did nobody listen to this song and think, ‘Let’s help this girl’.”

[Back then,] I was recording [the song] in a state of mind where I felt like I was OK — but clearly I wasn’t. I even listen back to it and I’m like, “Gosh, I wish I could go back in time to help that version of myself.”


Lovato’s GRAMMY performance of the track was first teased back in December 4, 2019, via Instagram with the caption, “The next time you hear from me, I’ll be singing….” Weeks later, on January 14, 2020, her performance of the then-unnamed song was announced.

According to the ‘musc insider’ who had correctly confirmed Lovato’s GRAMMY performance, the song will not serve as the lead single from her upcoming seventh studio album. This was previously pointed out by fans after discovering that the song has not been officially sent to radio.

songs.full_title: Lonely by Demi Lovato (Ft. Lil Wayne)

annotatable.link_title: Lonely by Demi Lovato (Ft. Lil Wayne)
annotatable.title: Lonely

body.plain:
Atop a wave of melancholy, Lovato sings of a seemingly unrequited love causing her to feel isolated in heart break. As she bemoans her precarious situation, the “How to Love” rapper, Lil Wayne lends his lyrical prowess to the track. Its production is handled by DJ Mustard, featuring sparse, ambient synths in contrasts with a trap-inflected minimalist beat.

Lil Wayne is the only collaboration on the standard version of Demi’s sixth studio album.

Lil Wayne is the only collaboration on the standard version of Demi’s sixth studio album.

songs.full_title: Smoke & Mirrors by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
‘Smoke & Mirrors’ is the 16th song on Demi Lovato’s Target version of her 6th studio album ‘Tell Me You Love Me’.

Lovato revealed recently in a VEVO live interview, that ‘Smoke & Mirrors’ was the only song she cried to when recording.

This song lyrically expresses that Lovato was blinded by the emotional abuse that her lover gave to her. Now that she sees the person for who they really are, it was all just a perfect illusion. Now she is questioning if she had made the right decision.

description_annotation.fragment: You Don’t Do It for Me Anymore

body.plain:
“You Don’t Do It For Me Anymore” is the third single, but second promotional single for her sixth studio album Tell Me You Love Me.

Although the ballad can be interpreted as a breakup song, Demi said that to her the lyrics cover a topic she has been very vocal about it after recovery: drugs and alcohol. As explained in an interview with Next Radio, Lovato is breaking up with her old self, her addiction doesn’t do it for her anymore.

songs.full_title: Heart Attack by Demi Lovato

body.plain: The lead single from Demi Lovato’s fourth studio album Demi, “Heart Attack” is a song about being afraid to fall in love. Described by Lovato herself as “the reverse of ”Give Your Heart a Break,"“ this song thoroughly and accurately details the emotions one experiences as one free falls into love despite all efforts not to.

songs.full_title: Cool for the Summer by Demi Lovato

annotatable.link_title: Cool for the Summer by Demi Lovato
annotatable.title: Cool for the Summer

body.plain:
Released on July 1st 2015, “Cool For The Summer” is Demi Lovato’s most controversial song yet.

The lyrics have the former Disney child star discussing a very sexual summer affair, along with a suggestive music video in which articles of clothing can be seen strewn around a crazy party scene.

“Cool for the Summer” is the lead single from Lovato’s fifth studio album, scheduled for release in fall 2015 through a partnership between previous label Hollywood Records, Island Records, and its new subsidiary Safehouse Records, co-founded by Lovato.

songs.full_title: Daddy Issues by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
“Daddy Issues,” is the fifth track from Tell Me You Love Me where Demi unveils the source of her attraction to “unavailable” men.

The term “Daddy Issues” refers the result of a messed up relationship with one’s father, or having an absent father in ones life. This results in younger women or men chasing older men and are even seeking a father figure from their relationships and mistreatment in some cases.

We are aware that Demi did not have a good connection with her biological father, Patrick Lovato, who died in 2013. Lovato has expressed her disconnection to her father from her previous songs, such as ‘For The Love of A Daughter (2011, Unbroken), ’Shouldn’t Come Back‘ (2013, Demi), ’Father‘ (2015, Confident).

songs.full_title: Give Your Heart a Break by Demi Lovato

annotatable.link_title: Give Your Heart a Break by Demi Lovato
annotatable.title: Give Your Heart a Break

body.plain:
“Give Your Heart a Break” is the last single from Demi Lovato’s third album Unbroken.

The song was written & produced by Josh Alexander and Billy Steinberg.

According to MTV, Demi explained that despite the play on the word “heartbreak” in the title, the song is the exact opposite, saying:

Last year, I began working on a song about a different love. It’s a song about showing someone you love that you’re the one right in front of them. This is a song about faith.“

The song peaked at #16 on the Billboard Hot 100, topped Billboard’s Mainstream Top 40 chart, #16 on Billboard’s Adult Contemporary chart, #12 on Billboard’s Adult Top 40 chart and #38 on Billboard’s Latin Pop Songs chart.

It was certified 3x Platinum by the RIAA with sales of 2,100,000.

annotatable.title: Ruin the Friendship

body.plain:
“Ruin The Friendship” is about stepping out of a platonic relationship and crossing the boundaries with said person. Prior to the album release, Demi revealed to MTV that there was a song she was nervous to release because it would make headlines.

In an interview for Noisey, she stated that the song isn’t related to Wilmer Valderrama, who she used to be in a long-term relationship with. Fans believe she’s singing about one of her oldest friends, Nick Jonas, based on the lyrics.

songs.full_title: Games by Demi Lovato

body.plain: The 10th song of Lovato’s 2017 album, TMYLM (Tell Me You Love Me), Games is a song about Lovato’s relationship with a playboy who seemingly plays hard-to-get. In this song, Lovato stresses how, though she does harbor romantic feelings for him, she could play the same game he does, and that if he stops doing so, they could be a real couple. Cry Baby, the 9th song of her album, is theorized to be the aftermath of this, where she depicts herself being the heart-breaker who is heart-broken, indicating that he did not take her message seriously, and continued playing games.

body.plain: a lot of this is straight from billboard.

Showing off a more adult sound, “Body Say” is the first single from Lovato’s new label, Island Records. The song was premiered at the first show of her Future Now Tour, which she co-headlines with Nick Jonas on June 29th. It was released soon after, with Demi tweeting:

https://twitter.com/ddlovato/status/748728093947236353

On instagram, Lovato also published numerous extra shots from the photoshoot for the album cover in promotion of the single’s release.

songs.full_title: Confident by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
Title-track “Confident” is the second single of Demi Lovato’s fifth studio album. It allegedly leaked online on 21 August 2015 and it officially came out on 18 September 2015.

Lovato revealed the single cover on 15 September 2015.

https://twitter.com/ddlovato/status/643854137147437056?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

A preview of the music video was revealed on social media on 3 October 2015. It was premiered through Vevo on 9 October 2015. It’s directed by Robert Rodriguez and features actress Michelle Rodriguez.

https://instagram.com/p/8Yf8tuOKgv/

Lovato shared on 4 October 2015 a video on YouTube where she tells about the story behind the song:

“You’ve had me underrated”, I wanted to shout that from the top of my lungs for years now. Now that I’m feeling great and I feel confident, I’m proud of the skin that I’m in. I’m wanting to share that with the world and showing everyone how you can go from feeling very insecure with body image issues to feeling proud of your body that you want to show it to the world.

songs.full_title: Warrior by Demi Lovato

body.plain: In this song Demi Lovato expresses that she wants to move on without letting her past (or maybe even her abusive father) disturb her any further. Even though she knows that she’ll never be able to forget about her past because she not only has metaphorical but also real scars, this song shows a very determined side because Demi is sure that nothing and no one can hurt her as much as it used to.

songs.full_title: Skyscraper by Demi Lovato

body.plain:
This song was the first single from Demi Lovato’s album Unbroken, released in 2011.

It is about the pain she felt when she was in rehab because of her issues with self-harm and eating disorders.
This song was an inspiration for a lot of people; especially girls and women who were in pain because of other people who would tear them down without any good reason.

body.plain: Demetria Devonne “Demi” Lovato (born August 20, 1992) is an American singer-songwriter, musician, and actress. She made her debut as a child actress in Barney & Friends. In 2008, she came to prominence as a starring cast member in the television film Camp Rock. She signed to Hollywood Records the same year, and released her debut studio album Don’t Forget in September 2008. It has been certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In 2009, Lovato was commissioned her television series, Sonny with a Chance. Now in 2018, she had six studio albums, “Don’t Forget” in 2008, “Here we go again” in 2009, “Unbroken” in 2011, “Confident” in 2015 and “Tell Me You Love Me” in 2017.
